Description: Ostracon, two fragments of the body of a brown-coloured pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous substance, with remains of eleven lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, now faded in places, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.140)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87653) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87653)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 170 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
